IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE HIGHER EDUCATION FOR APPROXIMATELY 1,800 STUDENTS
IRS990.MissionDesc: CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY PROVIDING STUDENT FOCUSED BACCALAUREATE AND GRADUATE EDUCATION IN THE SPIRIT OF THE SISTERS OF MERCY. WELCOMES WOMEN AND MEN OF ALL BELIEFS TO JOIN THE COMMUNITY IN PURSUIT OF EDUCATION AND SERVICE TO THOSE IN NEED. PROMOTES REFLECTIVE JUDGMENT, STRATEGIC COMMUNICATION, THE COMMON GOOD AND PURPOSEFUL LIVING THROUGH A CORE CURRICULUM, LIBERAL ARTS AND PROFESSIONAL MAJORS AND STUDENT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. STRIVE FOR EXCELLENCE IN ACCOMPLISHING OUR MISSION THROUGH FOUR INTERDEPENDENT GOALS: USING REFLECTIVE JUDGMENT, ENGAGING IN STRATEGIC COMMUNICATION, SERVING THE COMMON GOOD AND PROMOTING PURPOSEFUL LIVING.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION: PROVIDE GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE HIGHER EDUCATION IN PROGRAMS INCLUDING TRADITIONAL DAYTIME FORMAT, NON TRADITIONAL EVENING FORMAT, ONLINE, AND ACCELERATED EVENING AND WEEKEND FORMAT. DEGREES GRANTED INCLUDE MFT, MSN, MBA, MSL, MCJ, AND MA IN EDUCATION (GRADUATE PROGRAMS) AND BA, BS, BAS AND BBA (UNDERGRADUATE PROGRAMS). FOR FALL OF 2017, THERE WERE 1,179 TRADITIONAL, 201 ACCELERATED AND 331 GRADUATE AND 137 ONLINE STUDENTS. TOTAL UNDERGRADUATE FTE WAS 1,325; GRADUATE FTE WAS 283.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY SERVICES: PROVIDE RESIDENCE HALLS WITH CAPACITY OF 450 STUDENTS, MEALS (BOARD PLANS) FOR RESIDENTIAL AND NON-RESIDENTIAL STUDENTS AND BOOKSTORE FOR TEXTBOOK PURCHASES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ACADEMIC SUPPORT: PROVIDE ACADEMIC RESOURCES TO ALL STUDENTS INCLUDING LIBRARY SERVICES, COMPUTER CENTER AND LABS, ACADEMIC ASSISTANCE AND CAMPUS MINISTRIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: STUDENT SERVICES: ATHLETICS, HEALTH SERVICES, ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP FOR ENROLLMENT AND STUDENT SERVICES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND SUPPORT ACADEMIC PROGRAMS AND DEPARTMENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY IS RECOGNIZED AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE UNIVERSITY MAY BE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON ANY NET INCOME FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THE UNIVERSITY FILES A FORM 990 (RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX) ANNUALLY AND UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME (UBI) IS REPORTED ON FORM 990-T, AS APPROPRIATE. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR MATERIAL TAX POSITIONS, WHICH INCLUDE SUCH MATTERS AS THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS AND VARIOUS POSITIONS RELATIVE TO POTENTIAL SOURCES OF UBI. AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX BENEFITS IDENTIFIED AND RECORDED AS A LIABILITY. FORMS 990 AND 990-T FILED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FOR THE FISCAL YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2014 AND PRIOR.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 266,242. INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEES SHOWN AS EXPENSE -91,879.
SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS PAID 17,427,028. K-1 PASSTHROUGH INCOME -14,886. LOSS ON SALE OF BOOKSTORE ASSETS -109,398.
COST OF GOODS SOLD SHOWN UNDER REVENUE 266,242. LOSS ON SALE OF BOOKSTORE ASSETS 109,398.
SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS PAID 17,427,028. INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEES SHOWN AS EXPENSE 91,879.

EVEN THOUGH THE UNIVERSITY IS NOT REQUIRED TO USE THE NEWSPAPER IN ACCORDANCE WITH PARAGRAPH 4.03(2)(A) OF REV. PROC. 75-50, THE NONDICSCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PUBLISHED ON ITS WEBSITE WHICH WE VIEW AS A BROADCAST MEDIA THAT SERVES THE GENERAL PUBLIC. IN ADDITION, THE POLICY IS PROMOTED DURING STUDENT SOLICITATION TRIPS BY THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS WHEN THE SUBJECT IS RAISED. FINALLY, THE GENERAL PUBLIC IS AWARE OF THE UNIVERSITY'S RACIAL NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY BECAUSE OF THE UNIVERSITY'S CLOSE ASSOCIATION WITH THE ARCHDIOCESE OF DUBUQUE. DATA IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
MOUNT MERCY UNIVERSITY RECEIVES FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID AND GRANTS.

THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS IS MONITORED A MINIMUM OF ONCE EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH QUESTIONS REGARDING THE INTENT AND/OR INTERPRETATION OF THESE STANDARDS. COMPLETION RATE AND GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) REQUIREMENTS FULL-TIME STUDENTS (STUDENTS ATTEMPTING 12 OR MORE CREDIT HOURS EACH SEMESTER) MUST PROGRESS ACCORDING TO THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE: MINIMUM CREDITS MINIMUM REQUIRED SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED CUMULATIVE GPA YEAR 1 24 1.70 YEAR 2 48 2.00 YEAR 3 72 2.00 YEAR 4 96 2.00 YEAR 5 123 2.00 THESE CREDIT HOURS MUST BE EARNED DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR (FALL, WINTER AND SPRING). HOWEVER, IF A STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THESE REQUIRED HOURS, THEY MAY BE EARNED DURING THE FOLLOWING SUMMER SESSION(S). FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD BY THE END OF THE SUMMER WILL RESULT IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE COMPLETED CUMULATIVE HOURS MEET THE MINIMUM STANDARDS. LOSS OF AID IS NOT THE SAME AS ACADEMIC SUSPENSION, WHICH IS HANDLED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. PART-TIME STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ONE-HALF OF THE CREDIT HOURS THEY ATTEMPT. COMBINED STUDENTS (STUDENTS BLENDING TERMS OF FULL- AND PART-TIME ENROLLMENT) MUST ACHIEVE A CUMULATIVE TOTAL THAT SATISFIES THE COMBINED FULL- AND PART-TIME STANDARDS. STUDENTS WHO DO NOT ACHIEVE THE MINIMUM CUMULATIVE GPA ARE GRANTED ONE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER IN WHICH TO RAISE THEIR CUMULATIVE GPA TO THE MINIMUM. FAILURE TO ACHIEVE THIS STANDARD AT ANY POINT FOLLOWING THE PROBATIONARY SEMESTER RESULTS IN THE LOSS OF FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY UNTIL THE CUMULATIVE GPA MEETS THE MINIMUM STANDARDS.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: VP FOR ENROLLMENT AND STUDENT SERVIC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HOUSING ALLOWANCE AND PERSONAL SERVICES IS FOR THE HOUSE THAT MOUNT MERCY UNIVERSITY OWNS AND THE PRESIDENT RESIDES IN WHERE SHE CONDUCTS SIGNIFICANT BUSINESS ACTIVITIES AND HOLDS COLLEGE RELATED ENTERTAINMENT FUNCTIONS. SOCIAL CLUB DUES PAID BY THE ORGANIZATION ARE ALLOCATED BETWEEN BUSINESS AND PERSONAL BASED ON USAGE.
PART I, COLUMN (B) IS NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 6 - TOTAL NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS IS 250
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VOLUNTEERS CONSIST OF BOARD MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS FOR PHONATHON AND VOLUNTEER COACHES FOR EM, DEVELOPMENT AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS.
AS OF JUNE 1, 2018, MOUNT MERCY UNIVERSITY CEASED INTERNAL CAMPUS STORE OPERATIONS AND OUTSOURCED CAMPUS STORE NEEDS TO TREE OF LIFE BOOKSTORES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BARBARA KNAPP, BOARD TRUSTEE AND JIM NIKRANT, BOARD TRUSTEE HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS CONSIST OF BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND HONORARY MEMBERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS ARE THE BOARD TRUSTEES WHO ELECT MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY. ACCORDING TO THE BY-LAWS OF THE UNIVERSITY, PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR APPROVAL, NAMES FOR INITIAL TRUSTEES WILL BE SUBMITTED TO SISTERS OF MERCY WEST MIDWEST (SOM WMW). SOM WMW WILL HAVE THIRTY CALENDAR DAYS TO CONFIRM OR REJECT THE SUBMISSION. CONFIRMATION WILL NOT BE UNREASONABLY REFUSED. IF SOM WMW DOES NOT OBJECT WITHIN THIRTY DAYS OF RECEIPT OF THE SUBMISSION, THE SUBMISSION WILL BE DEEMED TO BE CONFIRMED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS ARE THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 PRIOR TO IT BEING FILED AND VOTES TO ACCEPT IT. EACH BOARD MEMBER RECEIVES A COPY OF THE COMPLETED 990 PRIOR TO THE RETURN BEING FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND EXECUTIVE STAFF SUBMIT THE COMPLETED COI QUESTIONNAIRE. THESE ARE REVIEWED BY THE ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT. BOARD MEMBERS AND EXECUTIVE STAFF DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN DECISIONS (EITHER DISCUSSION OR VOTING) REGARDING ITEMS WITH WHICH THEY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES EACH YEAR REVIEWS THE SALARY AND BENEFITS OF THE PRESIDENT, PROVOST, VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE, VICE PRESIDENT FOR DEVELOPMENT AND ALUMNI RELATIONS, VICE PRESIDENT FOR ADMINISTRATIVE, ENROLLMENT AND STUDENT AFFAIRS, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR MISSION AND MINISTRY. AS A PART OF THE REVIEW, THE SALARIES FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS IN HIGHER EDUCATION ARE RESEARCHED AND COMPARED WITH THE SALARIES AT MOUNT MERCY IN ORDER TO DETERMINE REASONABLENESS AND COMPETITIVENESS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE EITHER APPROVES THE SALARIES OR MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ADJUSTMENTS BASED UPON THE COMPARATIVE DATA SUPPLIED. ALL COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS,CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -21,727. CHANGE IN VALUE INTEREST RATE SWAPS 204,847. K-1 PASSTHROUGH INCOME 14,886.
